26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_fb_ramnv40.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:33 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include "ramnv40.h"
30
31#include <subdev/bios.h>
32#include <subdev/bios/bit.h>
33#include <subdev/bios/init.h>
34#include <subdev/bios/pll.h>
35#include <subdev/clk/pll.h>
36#include <subdev/timer.h>
37
38static int
39nv40_ram_calc(struct nvkm_ram *base, u32 freq)
40{
41 struct nv40_ram *ram = nv40_ram(base);
42 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &ram->base.fb->subdev;
43 struct nvkm_bios *bios = subdev->device->bios;
44 struct nvbios_pll pll;
45 int N1, M1, N2, M2;
46 int log2P, ret;
47
48 ret = nvbios_pll_parse(bios, 0x04, &pll);
49 if (ret) {
50 nvkm_error(subdev, "mclk pll data not found\n");
51 return ret;
52 }
53
54 ret = nv04_pll_calc(subdev, &pll, freq, &N1, &M1, &N2, &M2, &log2P);
55 if (ret < 0)
56 return ret;
57
58 ram->ctrl = 0x80000000 | (log2P << 16);
59 ram->ctrl |= min(pll.bias_p + log2P, (int)pll.max_p) << 20;
60 if (N2 == M2) {
61 ram->ctrl |= 0x00000100;
62 ram->coef = (N1 << 8) | M1;
63 } else {
64 ram->ctrl |= 0x40000000;
65 ram->coef = (N2 << 24) | (M2 << 16) | (N1 << 8) | M1;
66 }
67
68 return 0;
69}
70
71static int
72nv40_ram_prog(struct nvkm_ram *base)
73{
74 struct nv40_ram *ram = nv40_ram(base);
75 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &ram->base.fb->subdev;
76 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
77 struct nvkm_bios *bios = device->bios;
78 struct bit_entry M;
79 u32 crtc_mask = 0;
80 u8 sr1[2];
81 int i;
82
83 /* determine which CRTCs are active, fetch VGA_SR1 for each */
84 for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
85 u32 vbl = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x600808 + (i * 0x2000));
86 u32 cnt = 0;
87 do {
88 if (vbl != nvkm_rd32(device, 0x600808 + (i * 0x2000))) {
89 nvkm_wr08(device, 0x0c03c4 + (i * 0x2000), 0x01);
90 sr1[i] = nvkm_rd08(device, 0x0c03c5 + (i * 0x2000));
91 if (!(sr1[i] & 0x20))
92 crtc_mask |= (1 << i);
93 break;
94 }
95 udelay(1);
96 } while (cnt++ < 32);
97 }
98
99 /* wait for vblank start on active crtcs, disable memory access */
100 for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
101 if (!(crtc_mask & (1 << i)))
102 continue;
103
104 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
105 u32 tmp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x600808 + (i * 0x2000));
106 if (!(tmp & 0x00010000))
107 break;
108 );
109
110 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
111 u32 tmp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x600808 + (i * 0x2000));
112 if ( (tmp & 0x00010000))
113 break;
114 );
115
116 nvkm_wr08(device, 0x0c03c4 + (i * 0x2000), 0x01);
117 nvkm_wr08(device, 0x0c03c5 + (i * 0x2000), sr1[i] | 0x20);
118 }
119
120 /* prepare ram for reclocking */
121 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x1002d4, 0x00000001); /* precharge */
122 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x1002d0, 0x00000001); /* refresh */
123 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x1002d0, 0x00000001); /* refresh */
124 nvkm_mask(device, 0x100210, 0x80000000, 0x00000000); /* no auto refresh */
125 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x1002dc, 0x00000001); /* enable self-refresh */
126
127 /* change the PLL of each memory partition */
128 nvkm_mask(device, 0x00c040, 0x0000c000, 0x00000000);
129 switch (device->chipset) {
130 case 0x40:
131 case 0x45:
132 case 0x41:
133 case 0x42:
134 case 0x47:
135 nvkm_mask(device, 0x004044, 0xc0771100, ram->ctrl);
136 nvkm_mask(device, 0x00402c, 0xc0771100, ram->ctrl);
137 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x004048, ram->coef);
138 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x004030, ram->coef);
139 case 0x43:
140 case 0x49:
141 case 0x4b:
142 nvkm_mask(device, 0x004038, 0xc0771100, ram->ctrl);
143 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x00403c, ram->coef);
144 default:
145 nvkm_mask(device, 0x004020, 0xc0771100, ram->ctrl);
146 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x004024, ram->coef);
147 break;
148 }
149 udelay(100);
150 nvkm_mask(device, 0x00c040, 0x0000c000, 0x0000c000);
151
152 /* re-enable normal operation of memory controller */
153 nvkm_wr32(device, 0x1002dc, 0x00000000);
154 nvkm_mask(device, 0x100210, 0x80000000, 0x80000000);
155 udelay(100);
156
157 /* execute memory reset script from vbios */
158 if (!bit_entry(bios, 'M', &M)) {
159 struct nvbios_init init = {
160 .subdev = subdev,
161 .bios = bios,
162 .offset = nvbios_rd16(bios, M.offset + 0x00),
163 .execute = 1,
164 };
165
166 nvbios_exec(&init);
167 }
168
169 /* make sure we're in vblank (hopefully the same one as before), and
170 * then re-enable crtc memory access
171 */
172 for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
173 if (!(crtc_mask & (1 << i)))
174 continue;
175
176 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
177 u32 tmp = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x600808 + (i * 0x2000));
178 if ( (tmp & 0x00010000))
179 break;
180 );
181
182 nvkm_wr08(device, 0x0c03c4 + (i * 0x2000), 0x01);
183 nvkm_wr08(device, 0x0c03c5 + (i * 0x2000), sr1[i]);
184 }
185
186 return 0;
187}
188
189static void
190nv40_ram_tidy(struct nvkm_ram *base)
191{
192}
193
194static const struct nvkm_ram_func
195nv40_ram_func = {
196 .calc = nv40_ram_calc,
197 .prog = nv40_ram_prog,
198 .tidy = nv40_ram_tidy,
199};
200
201int
202nv40_ram_new_(struct nvkm_fb *fb, enum nvkm_ram_type type, u64 size,
203 u32 tags, struct nvkm_ram **pram)
204{
205 struct nv40_ram *ram;
206 if (!(ram = kzalloc(sizeof(*ram), GFP_KERNEL)))
207 return -ENOMEM;
208 *pram = &ram->base;
209 return nvkm_ram_ctor(&nv40_ram_func, fb, type, size, tags, &ram->base);
210}
211
212int
213nv40_ram_new(struct nvkm_fb *fb, struct nvkm_ram **pram)
214{
215 struct nvkm_device *device = fb->subdev.device;
216 u32 pbus1218 = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x001218);
217 u32 size = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x10020c) & 0xff000000;
218 u32 tags = nvkm_rd32(device, 0x100320);
219 enum nvkm_ram_type type = NVKM_RAM_TYPE_UNKNOWN;
220 int ret;
221
222 switch (pbus1218 & 0x00000300) {
223 case 0x00000000: type = NVKM_RAM_TYPE_SDRAM; break;
224 case 0x00000100: type = NVKM_RAM_TYPE_DDR1 ; break;
225 case 0x00000200: type = NVKM_RAM_TYPE_GDDR3; break;
226 case 0x00000300: type = NVKM_RAM_TYPE_DDR2 ; break;
227 }
228
229 ret = nv40_ram_new_(fb, type, size, tags, pram);
230 if (ret)
231 return ret;
232
233 (*pram)->parts = (nvkm_rd32(device, 0x100200) & 0x00000003) + 1;
234 return 0;
235}
